isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - REMOVE

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER ASSEMBLY FROM AXLE HOUSING

important.para: The following instructions are applicable to axles equipped with Controlled Traction Differentials.

step1.para: All Types CTD: Drain lubricant. Disconnect drive shaft and remove axle shafts. Remove differential carrier to axle housing bolts and lockwashers or stud nuts. Remove differential carrier.

Driver-Controlled CTD: Disconnect air line to permit removal of shift unit. Remove shift unit nuts and flat washers. Place sliding clutch in the engaged position. NOTE: Sliding clutch must be engaged to allow removal of carrier from housing.

Seasonal CTD: Remove nuts and washers from shift fork cover retainer, then remove cover retainer. Place sliding clutch in the engaged position. NOTE: Sliding clutch must be engaged to allow removal of carrier from housing.
Permanent CTD: This type CTD is always engaged. No procedure is necessary.
